items.title: Notification Pagination
concatenate notifications
items.body:
Is it possile to concatenate notifications?
eg: if in a day 50 users started following me then I wouldn't want 50 notifications. I would like to have a single notification stating "xyz and 49 others started following you"

same goes for comments and likes on a single post

items.title: Documentation is so minimal and hard to follow
items.body:
Hi. I am a student with intermediate experience in Django. I've been trying to implement the notification system for almost a day now and I haven't got past the point of showing live notifications and linking them to the default template area.

The documentation is insufficient for me as I find it hard to make sense of what is happening without an example or code.

For example, the documentation says what to put in the template, but nothing about how to mark messages unread, or how to override the default templates. It does say to use API calls to mark read messages unread, but not how.

I'd contribute to the wiki if I know how to do all this, but I need help. Can someone link me to a proper way to use this app (perhaps a GitHub project that uses it in a simple way (I checked the test app, but it's not easy to follow in the context of setting up either))? Once I understand, maybe I can contribute to the project wiki.

This is a very nice project and I very much love to use it in my apps, learn, and contribute. Please help me.

items.title: Move logic of notify_handler
items.body: notify_handler should live separately apart from models. It can be either moved to `signals.py` or `handlers.py`

items.title: Remove hard links to Notification model
items.body: Instead of loading model using swapper module, it has been directly imported. There also exists an app label in AbstractNotification.Meta which creates conflict when it is extended.

items.title: Conflict model when create custom Notification inherit from AbstractNotification.
items.body:
Like document purpose, I already need to add category to filter notification based on category but when I create custom class inherit form AbstractNotification, django raise exceptions...

```
# models.py

from django.db import models
from django.utils.translation import gettext_lazy as _
from notifications.base.models import AbstractNotification


class Notification(AbstractNotification):
    class Meta(AbstractNotification.Meta):
        abstract = False

    CHOICES_CATEGORY_EVENT = 'EVENT'
    CHOICES_CATEGORY_WORK = 'WORK'
    CHOICES_CATEGORY_COMMENT = 'COMMENT'
    CHOICES_CATEGORY_URGENT = 'URGENT'
    CHOICES_CATEGORY_COMPANY = 'COMPANY'
    CHOICES_CATEGORIES = (
        (CHOICES_CATEGORY_EVENT, _('Event')),
        (CHOICES_CATEGORY_WORK, _('Work')),
        (CHOICES_CATEGORY_COMMENT, _('Comment')),
        (CHOICES_CATEGORY_URGENT, _('Urgent')),
        (CHOICES_CATEGORY_COMPANY, _('Company')),
    )

    category = models.CharField(
        max_length=63,
        choices=CHOICES_CATEGORIES,
        default=None,
        null=True,
        blank=True,
    )
```

Exception from terminal:
```

items.title: Swappable models

items.title: django-notifications breaks in django 1.11 TypeError: from_db_value() takes 4 positional arguments but 5 were given.
items.body:
Hi, recently we faced issue with django notifications on django 1.11. 
While reading notifications using queryset: `models.Notification.objects.filter(recipient=request.user)`,

we got TypeError as `TypeError: from_db_value() takes 4 positional arguments but 5 were given.`

Please note that I'm able to create new notifications, the only issue is while reading notifications using above queryset. I have tried changing queryset with `.all()` and other filter options. But no luck.

Here are the details about environments:
Django==1.11.1
django-model-utils==3.2.0
Python==3.6
PostgreSQL==12.1

Possible Root Cause:
I have looked into django-model-utils dependency. and Probably the error is causing because while installing django-notifications it is fetching django-model-utils==4.0 instead of 3.2. 
As django-model-utils 4.0 have dropped support for django 1.11 it might causing an error.

Please find attached traceback for refrence puprpose:

items.title: Live Tags doesn't work with bootstrap classes!
items.body:
I tried many times if I enter badge_class it does't work as real time
`
{% live_notify_badge badge_class="badge badge-danger badge-counter" %}
`

When I deleted classes, it works!
`
{% live_notify_badge %}
`

Please help.

items.title: Compatibility with Django 3.0
items.body:
There are some issues with running django-notifications on Django 3.0

- Depends on django.utils.six (only in models.py)
- Depends on django-jsonfield which depends on django.utils.six
- Possibly more

Django-jsonfield is basically deprecated, especially since there will be a native json-field coming in Django 3.1.

items.title: Suggestion add get_absolute_url info for Actor, Target and Action_object (if they have it)
items.body:
In order to allow for more interactive notifications suggest that in views.py and the different views used for live notification in the JSON returned also add info about the URLs for Actor, Target and Action Object (if they have any).
 
So in cases where
```
        if notification.actor:
            struct['actor'] = str(notification.actor)
```
also add some check that have absolut_url and then just add

`struct['actor_absolute_url'] = str(notification.actor.get_absolute_url())`
`
Then it would be easy to create own new notification_listener and register this and present URLs in notification messages if URLs provided as links to them.

I just `cloned` and want to `makemigrations`  but I've got error which is ( at the end of line):

ImportError: cannot import name 'login'
```

items.title: Is this project maintained?
items.body: There seems to be too many simple issues and unresolved PR's. Is this project maintained?

items.title: split settings fails
Passing in a URL.
items.body:
Hi, when I create a new notification, is there a simple way for the target to be a link back to that item, rather than just it printing the name of the target?

I already have 'DJANGO_NOTIFICATIONS_CONFIG = { 'USE_JSONFIELD': True, 'SOFT_DELETE': True }', and have added the extra field 'url' as such:
        ```notify.send(sender=self.request.user, recipient=self.object.question.user,
                    verb='answered your question', target=self.object.question, url="/")```
But how can I get url to be printed without actually editing the notify.js file?

items.title: Wrong documentation about extra data?
items.body:
In docs you said:

> Add to your settings.py: DJANGO_NOTIFICATIONS_CONFIG = { 'USE_JSONFIELD': True}

But extra data not working. Taking a look to the source code I see that instead should be used (and so it works):

NOTIFICATIONS_USE_JSONFIELD = True

Django==1.11.7
django-notifications-hq==1.4.0

items.title: I can not get the object list with "live-updater with bootstrap"
items.body:
Hi guys, the notification live-updater works fine for me but
when i use the live-updater with bootstrap in the template
`{% live_notify_list list_class="dropdown-menu" %}`
the list of objects is not refreshed
![with change template](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1774655/41186329-974b3ad0-6b62-11e8-8e87-2fed21e053f4.jpg)
but when I use it by default, I can get the list of objects.
![without change template](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1774655/41186447-b4e18124-6b64-11e8-8824-b5a2e2397c52.jpg)
The only way that works for me is modifying the two lines of the file notifications_tags.py
```
def register_notify_callbacks (badge_class = 'live_notify_badge',
                               menu_class = 'dropdown-menu',
```

```
@ register.simple_tag
def live_notify_list (list_class = 'dropdown-menu'):
```
and works
![with change notifications_tags-py](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1774655/41186330-977eee98-6b62-11e8-9654-b33489a2c3c8.jpg)

*and another thing, is there any way to get the live-updater with more css in the < li > ?, I liked the result that I get with the static list, maybe use the template list.html for the live-updater?

```
  File "/home/circleci/venv/src/django-notifications-hq/notifications/models.py", line 240, in <module>
    EXTRA_DATA = notifications_settings.get_config()['USE_JSONFIELD']
KeyError: 'USE_JSONFIELD'
```

items.title: I find some problem just like 【warnerror3】can not find site-packages/django_notifications_hq-1.4.0a0-py3.6.egg/notifications/migrations
items.body:
IF you have this problem，you can do this：
**my django==2.0** 
1.git clone https://github.com/django-notifications/django-notifications
cd django-notifications
python setup.py install
2. go to \Python36\Lib\site-packages
3.creat a folder named **django_notifications_hq-1.4.0a0-py3.6.egg** ，before this action，you must delete file named **django_notifications_hq-1.4.0a0-py3.6.egg**
4.  Back to step 1
find and open the folder named django-notifications
my django-notifications folder path is C:\Users\Administrator\django-notifications
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31615794/40537368-5716ce74-6041-11e8-997a-d1563e82cb06.png)
5. open folder named **django_notifications_hq.egg-info**
copy all files into the folder we creat in step 3
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31615794/40537400-66494426-6041-11e8-90ab-c3039cda81e6.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31615794/40537417-7176c8be-6041-11e8-930f-f751fac6a220.png)
6. copy the folder named **notifications**  into **\Python36\Lib\site-packages**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31615794/40537500-a2fe514a-6041-11e8-9ff4-53c11777969b.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31615794/40537510-ad6eb0c0-6041-11e8-89bd-99f9a44f0d2c.png)

OK，you can enjoy your work

PS:
https://github.com/django-notifications/django-notifications/pull/211 
The way in this can not solve my problem，it doesn't work

any idea

items.title: Generic relationship object_id fields should use PositiveIntegerField
items.body:
Currently, `actor_object_id`, `target_object_id`, `action_object_object_id` are all `CharField` instead of `PositiveIntegerField`.

This is problematic at least in Django set-ups that use PostgreSQL, which fail to run queries involving primary keys (which are integer fields) and django-notification's `object_id` fields  a  with the following error message:

```
django.db.utils.ProgrammingError: operator does not exist: integer = character varying
LINE 1: ...M "app_model" WHERE NOT ("app_model"."id" IN (SELECT...
                                                             ^
HINT:  No operator matches the given name and argument type(s). You might need to add explicit type casts.
```

*(where app_model is the actual database table)*

Please change object_id fields from `CharField` to `PositiveIntegerField`

Why I get this error?
I install the package, add the app in my `INSTALLED_APPS` and migrate the database. According to the project readme, I add the code in my `models.py`:
```python
from django.db.models.signals import post_save
from notifications.signals import notify
def my_handler(sender, instance, created, **kwargs):
    notify.send(instance, verb='created topic success')


post_save.connect(my_handler, sender=Topic)
```
After that, I run my project, and I got the error: `KeyError: 'recipient'`

items.title: Custom Signal from django.dispatch not working
items.body:
I need to send notification and make it unread=False. I replaced `notify` variable to extend `providing_args`, but notifications are not sent (even if I remove `unread` arg).
I tried `notify.send_robust()` - the same results and don't know even how catch error or what happened
This code I placed in `views.py`:

```
from django.dispatch import Signal

notify = Signal(providing_args=[
    'recipient', 'actor', 'verb', 'action_object', 'target', 'description',
    'timestamp', 'level', 'unread'
])

s = notify.send(request.user, recipient=agency, verb='my_verb', target=project, unread=False)
# `s` is [] now
```

Django version: 1.11

items.title: Question: Is the project supported on Django 1.11?
items.body: Hello, is the app supported on Django 1.11 and if not, what are the plans for that?

items.title: XMLHttpRequest update
items.body: The [XMLHttpRequest](https://xhr.spec.whatwg.org/#events) API has been updated and the event _onready_ has not exist anymore. _[fetch_api_data](https://github.com/django-notifications/django-notifications/blob/master/notifications/static/notifications/notify.js#L45)_ needs be updated to support the new events.

items.title: `notify_handler(...)` should return a list of created `Notification` instances instead of `None`
items.body:
We can use the `notify` signal in the following way:

```
from notifications.signals import notify
...
...
notify.send(user, recipient=user, verb='you reached level 10')
```

But the `notify_handler(...)` does not return anything when it could return a list of newly created `Notification` instances which could be of use to the sender. This could allow for something like this:

```
from notifications.signals import notify
from notifications.models import notify_handler
from my.code import send_notification_email
...
...
result = notify.send(user, recipient=user, verb='you reached level 10')
for r in result:
    if r[0] is notify_handler:
        for n in r[1]:
            send_notification_email(n)
```

items.title: Add kwargs support for mark_as_read(unread) views
items.body:
In current version, the mark_as_read(unread) views only accept a request argument. Sometimes people would add another argument in their URL pattern. For example: /(?P<username>).+/notifications. But now the views can't handle this argument. Add the **kwargs in views would solve this problem. Such as:

```
def mark_as_read(request,*args,**kwargs):
    ...
```

Nerade

items.title: if the template tag {{ unread_count }} doesn't work
items.body:
put `conntext_instance=RequestContext(request)`  into your view.

```
    return render_to_response('forum/node-view.html', {'request': request, 'title': n.title,
                                                 'conf': conf,
                                                 'topics': topics,
                                                 'node': n,
                                                 'node_view': True,
                                                 'pager': page,},
                              context_instance=RequestContext(request)
                              )
```

do not know why, but it works.

`

items.title: Postgres errors
items.body:
actor_object_id
target_object_id  
action_object_object_id
- all the fields have varchar types, that makes it impossible to build queries joining notifications with other tables :(

so, when trying to filter notifications by user id/role get an error in Postgres (cause it's strict about field types):

```
operator does not exist: character varying = integer
LINE 1: ... ( "notifications_notification"."actor_object_id" = "main_us...
                                                             ^
HINT:  No operator matches the given name and argument type(s). You might need to add explicit type casts.
```

could we set that id fields as int? what was the reason to not to do it?

items.title: Cannot display unread notifications, tags are not loading
items.body:
I'm having trouble displaying even the count of unread notifications in html, I have included the {% load notifications_tags %} at the start of the html file and have tried placing in a div: {% notifications_unread %} but I do not have any variables being passed through with that name, is there any other steps I need to take?

If I manually construct the user in a python console and call 'user.notifications.unread()', it is returning the new unread notifications, so I know that that is working.

Do I need to adjust my views such that it is passing certain variables through the context?

items.title: HTTP 500 error in notifications API when unauthenticated
items.body:
Related to this issue: https://github.com/aristotle-mdr/aristotle-metadata-registry/issues/335

---

> The notifications application attempts to load the user's notifications from `/account/notifications/api/unread_list/` whether or not the user is authenticated. This results in an HTTP 500 error for unauthenticated users in my test instance and the pythonanywhere.com instance with the exception:
> 
> ```
> Exception Value: 'AnonymousUser' object has no attribute 'notifications'
> ```
> 
> You can see it on the demo server here http://aristotle.pythonanywhere.com/account/notifications/api/unread_list/?max=10 (assuming you are unauthenticated).

items.title: pypi installation has migration errors
items.body:
Not sure if the actual 1.0 is released on the pypi.  The error is the migration file is using `notifications.now` when it should be using `django.utils.timezone.now`.  I see it's fixed in the source here, but pypi still includes the reference to `notifications.now`

Using the 1.0 release.

items.title: Missing migration
items.body:
When I run `python manage.py makemigrations` django1.9 creates new migration for notifications package:

``` python
...
class Migration(migrations.Migration):

    dependencies = [
        ('notifications', '0004_auto_20150826_1508'),
    ]

    operations = [
        migrations.AlterField(
            model_name='notification',
            name='level',
            field=models.CharField(max_length=20, default='info', choices=[('success', 'success'), ('info', 'info'), ('warning', 'warning'), ('error', 'error')]),
        ),
    ]
```

whats wrong?

items.title: Live update template
items.body:
Hi, thank you for this package.
I would like to use the live update callback to build github-like notification on a bootstrapped dropdown menu but the object returned from api/unread_list does not contains the urls that I have to use to build the hrefs.
How i can reproduce the main example in README (with links)?
justquick (actor) closed (verb) issue 2 (object) on activity-stream (target) 12 hours ago

p.s. i've to convert the timestamp also in timesince.

items.title: Lack of AJAX functionality
items.body:
Hi, great package, thanks for it, good job!

In my opinion it doesn't have some ajax functionality. It's not the good idea to re render and redirect a user to the same page after marking a single `notice` as read. It would be nice to add this functionality as in most cases we use this marking buttons near the notice and don't want to reload the page.

I think it's possible to check if `request.is_ajax()` in views and perform certain actions. What are your thoughts on this?

items.title: Typo in README.md
items.body:
from notifications.signal import notify

The 'signal' should be 'signals'.

items.title: AppRegistryNotReady with Django 1.9
items.body:
I use Django 1.9 and django-notifications-hq 0.8.0. When I run `python manage.py runserver`, it raises this exception. When I remove `notifications` from `INSTALLED_APPS`, the exception goes away.

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./manage.py", line 10, in <module>
    execute_from_command_line(sys.argv)
  File "/home/me/myproject/.venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/core/management/__init__.py", line 350, in execute_from_command_line
    utility.execute()
  File "/home/me/myproject/.venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/core/management/__init__.py", line 342, in execute
    self.fetch_command(subcommand).run_from_argv(self.argv)
  File "/home/me/myproject/.venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/core/management/__init__.py", line 176, in fetch_command
    commands = get_commands()
  File "/home/me/myproject/.venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/utils/lru_cache.py", line 100, in wrapper
    result = user_function(*args, **kwds)
  File "/home/me/myproject/.venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/core/management/__init__.py", line 71, in get_commands
    for app_config in reversed(list(apps.get_app_configs())):
  File "/home/me/myproject/.venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/apps/registry.py", line 137, in get_app_configs
    self.check_apps_ready()
  File "/home/me/myproject/.venv/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/apps/registry.py", line 124, in check_apps_ready
    raise AppRegistryNotReady("Apps aren't loaded yet.")
django.core.exceptions.AppRegistryNotReady: Apps aren't loaded yet.
```

items.title: Support For Django 1.9 In pip installed package
items.body:
Two things seem to be true about the version of django-notifications-hq which pip installs:
1. It's incompatible with django 1.9
2. The source isn't the same as what's presently in the git repo, for example **init**.py

Am I missing something? Or will it take some time until a compatible version makes it into pip?

items.title: PassThroughManager removed from django-model-utils
items.body:
Recent version of django-model-utils removed PassThroughManager -> https://github.com/carljm/django-model-utils/blob/master/CHANGES.rst

PassThroughManager will need to be replaced here https://github.com/django-notifications/django-notifications/blob/master/notifications/models.py#L193
Use Django's built-in QuerySet.as_manager() and/or Manager.from_queryset() utilities instead.

items.title: django-model-utils - Remove PassThroughManager
items.body:
Error in File "\notifications\models.py", line 193, in Notification
    objects = managers.PassThroughManager.for_queryset_class(NotificationQuerySet)()

because

in django-model-utils version 2.4 remove PassThroughManager (https://github.com/carljm/django-model-utils/blob/master/CHANGES.rst)

items.title: model_utils removed PassThroughManager
items.body:
prior to model_utils 2.4 the PassThroughManager has been removed.

please see
https://github.com/carljm/django-model-utils/commit/2824ec2e4875ab6530caa440034959d51d5b9830

items.title: AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'PassThroughManager'
items.body:
I'm unable to import any notification.models because they reference a manager that no longer exists in a dependent package:

```
Traceback:
   File "/usr/local/myproject/src/myproject/myapp/models.py", line 100, in <module>
     from notifications.models import Notification
   File "/usr/local/myproject/.env/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/notifications/models.py", line 123, in <module>
     class Notification(models.Model):
   File "/usr/local/myproject/.env/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/notifications/models.py", line 185, in Notification
     objects = managers.PassThroughManager.for_queryset_class(NotificationQuerySet)()
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'PassThroughManager'
```

It looks like [PassThroughManager](https://github.com/carljm/django-model-utils/blob/master/model_utils/managers.py) was removed but the setup.py still allows this incompatible version to be installed.

items.title: Abandon Django 1.4-1.6 support
New version of django-model-utils doesn't have PassThroughManager
items.body: New version of django-model-utils doesn't have PassThroughManager.  When I then go pip install --upgrade it errors `AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute 'PassThroughManager'`

-Thanks!

items.body:

Invalid block tag: 'register_notify_callbacks'

items.title: Notifications for many users
items.body:
Hi! 

I was checking the project and I found it really great! , I am using it in mi app to notify when a meeting is programed, is edited or is canceled. I need to notify  about the meeting changes for all meeting guests. 

I tried to pass an array in the parameter recipient however it get me an error. Is there any way to notify all my meeting guests about the meeting changes? Can I use the lib for that purpose? 

Thanks! 

Best regards

items.title: JSON access to recent notifications
items.body:
Some projects may find it useful to have an easy to drop in Javascript/JSON function with an appropriate updating field that fetches notifications on behalf of the user:

For example, inserting the code similar to the following into a template:

```
{% load notifications_tags %}
{% live_notify_icon %}
```

Would provide an auto-updating notification badge indicating there are unread notfications, without a page refresh.

Similarly, something like this:

```
{% load notifications_tags %}
{% live_notify_menu 5 %}
```

Would provide a simple `ul` menu with the 5 most recent unread notifications (with the number being configurable).

I've assigned this bug to me already and can do some work on it, and if there is interest we can look at pulling it in.

For reference, this would be done in a way that adds no extra requirements, and done using raw javascript so we don't force libraries like jquery onto users.

Any thoughts on this?

items.title: ?next={{ some_url }} doesn't url_decode {{ some_url }}
items.body:
Suppose I send a user to `/inbox/notifications/mark-as-read/111270/` but I want to send them on to another page straight away.

So I use e.g.:

`/inbox/notifications/mark-as-read/111270/?next=/some_page/

But if I want to send them to e.g. `/some_page/?get_var=hello_world` I get stuck. I can urlencode the `?next=` url but django-notifications doesn't decode this correctly.  Is there a reason for this? If not I'll form the repo and add the urldecode to `views.py`'s `_next` bits.
